column1: Sugars and starches are broken down by the body into glucose (blood sugar) to be used as energy.
STARCHES These nutrient-rich foods are high in starch.

Many are also high in fiber: - Canned and dried beans, such as kidney beans, black beans, pinto beans, black-eyed peas, split peas, and garbanzo beans - Starchy vegetables, such as potatoes, corn, green peas, and parsnips - Whole grains, such as brown rice, oats, barley, and quinoa Refined grains, such as those found in pastries, white bread, crackers, and white rice also contain starch.
Severely restricting carbohydrates can cause ketosis.
